recipe.name: Smashed Potatoes With Bacon & Eggs
recipe.description: A versatile breakfast-for-dinner dish combining crispy smashed potatoes, fried eggs basted in bacon fat, crunchy greens, and a tangy spicy sour cream drizzle.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large russet potatoes, scrubbed and pricked with a fork
olive oil, plus more as needed
kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
scallions, thinly sliced on the bias
crunchy lettuce or tender greens (e.g., arugula, spinach)

steps: Preheat oven to 425°F. Place potatoes on a baking sheet and bake until very soft, about 50–60 minutes. Remove and use a pot lid to smash each potato.
Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and bake for 15 minutes until crispy. Keep warm in the oven.
Whisk sour cream and hot sauce in a small bowl, thinning with water to a drizzle-able consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-low heat until crisp, about 15 minutes. Remove bacon and set aside. Pour rendered fat into a heatproof container, reserving 3 tablespoons in the skillet.
Fry eggs in batches in the bacon fat over medium heat, basting with hot fat for crispy edges. Season with salt and pepper.
To serve, divide greens among plates. Top each with a crispy smashed potato, two fried eggs, crumbled bacon, sour cream drizzle, and scallions.
A little effort, a lot of flavor—dig in and savor!
